intro: Prestonia seriocalyx, commonly known as the narrow-leaved prestonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a prominent corona. It produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky, resinous coating.
